sentences: Michael Holbrook Penniman Jr. (born 18 August 1983), known by his stage name Mika ( MEE-kə, stylised as MIKA), is a Lebanese-born British singer-songwriter.
section: N/A

sentences: After recording his first extended play, Dodgy Holiday, Mika was named the number-one predicted breakthrough act of 2007 in an annual BBC poll of music critics, Sound of 2007.
section: N/A

sentences: Mika released his first full-length studio album, Life in Cartoon Motion, on Island Records in 2007, which sold more than 5.6 million copies worldwide and helped Mika win a Brit Award—winning Best British Breakthrough act—and receive a Grammy Award nomination.
section: N/A

sentences: He topped the UK Singles Chart in January 2007 with "Grace Kelly".
section: N/A

sentences: He has since gone on to record four more studio albums (most recently My Name is Michael Holbrook released in October 2019), as well as serve as judge/mentor on both the French version of The Voice and the Italian version of X Factor.
section: N/A

sentences: Mika has also starred in his own television variety show in Italy, Stasera Casa Mika, which won the 2017 Rose d'Or Award for Entertainment.
section: N/A

== Life and career == | === 1983–2006: Childhood and early career ===

sentences: Mika was born in Beirut, the third of five children (three sisters Yasmine, Paloma and Zuleika and one brother Fortuné), to an American-born Lebanese mother and an Israeli-born American father, Mary Joan "Joannie" (née Mouakad, daughter of John Mouakad and Odette Farah) and Michael Holbrook Penniman (son of William Frederick Penniman III and Dorothy Dyar).
section: == Life and career == | === 1983–2006: Childhood and early career ===

sentences: His father was a banker and was born in Jerusalem, where his own father – Mika's paternal grandfather William Frederick Penniman III – was a diplomat.
section: == Life and career == | === 1983–2006: Childhood and early career ===

sentences: Mika's maternal grandfather John Mouakad was Syrian (from Damascus).
section: == Life and career == | === 1983–2006: Childhood and early career ===

sentences: When Mika was a year old, his family was forced to leave war-torn Lebanon and moved to Paris, France.
section: == Life and career == | === 1983–2006: Childhood and early career ===

sentences: The first piano piece he learned to play was "Les Champs-Élysées", by Joe Dassin.
section: == Life and career == | === 1983–2006: Childhood and early career ===

sentences: At the age of 7, he wrote his first song, a piano instrumental called "Angry", which he describes as "awful".
section: == Life and career == | === 1983–2006: Childhood and early career ===

sentences: The family moved to London when he was 9 years old.
section: == Life and career == | === 1983–2006: Childhood and early career ===

sentences: There, he attended the Lycée Français Charles de Gaulle, where he experienced severe bullying.
section: == Life and career == | === 1983–2006: Childhood and early career ===

sentences: He also had problems with dyslexia.
section: == Life and career == | === 1983–2006: Childhood and early career ===

sentences: In response to these experiences Mika was home-schooled by his mother at the age of 12, for six to eight months.
section: == Life and career == | === 1983–2006: Childhood and early career ===

sentences: He then attended St Philip's School in Kensington, where he was the head of the Schola Cantorum (the St. Philip's Choir).
section: == Life and career == | === 1983–2006: Childhood and early career ===

sentences: Later he attended Westminster School and the Royal College of Music, which he left to record his first album at Casablanca Records.
section: == Life and career == | === 1983–2006: Childhood and early career ===

sentences: As a child Mika was trained by Alla Ardakov (Ablaberdyeva), a Russian opera professional.
section: == Life and career == | === 1983–2006: Childhood and early career ===

sentences: Mika's first single was a limited 7"/download release called "Relax, Take It Easy" (2006).
section: == Life and career == | === 1983–2006: Childhood and early career ===

sentences: It was play-listed by UK's BBC Radio 1 and was made Record of the Week by DJ Scott Mills.
section: == Life and career == | === 1983–2006: Childhood and early career ===

sentences: The Dodgy Holiday EP also became available for download.
section: == Life and career == | === 1983–2006: Childhood and early career ===

sentences: The song "Billy Brown" was available for free download for a week from the iTunes Store.

sentences: A song titled 'Over-rated', which was recorded in 2004, was "unofficially" released online.

sentences: His debut album Life in Cartoon Motion has a coming of age theme and deals with his transition from childhood to the present, though he has stated that not all of the songs are autobiographical.

section: == Life and career == | === 2007–2008: Life in Cartoon Motion ===

sentences: In another example of dealing with more difficult subject matter, in the song "Billy Brown", Mika writes about a married man who has a homosexual affair.
section: == Life and career == | === 2007–2008: Life in Cartoon Motion ===

sentences: On 20 February 2008, Mika opened the 2008 Brit Awards with a live performance of "Love Today," "Grace Kelly," and a duet, "Standing in the Way of Control", with Beth Ditto.

sentences: He was later awarded the BRIT Award for Best British Breakthrough Artist.

sentences: Mika recorded the majority of the album in Los Angeles with producer and musician Greg Wells, who also produced his debut album Life in Cartoon Motion.

section: == Life and career == | === 2009–2010: The Boy Who Knew Too Much ===

== Life and career == | === 2021–present ===

sentences: 2021–present ===
section: == Life and career == | === 2021–present ===

sentences: With touring and most live performances on hold during the COVID-19 pandemic, Mika turned to other projects in 2021.
section: == Life and career == | === 2021–present ===

sentences: In March 2021, Mika launched a project that was billed as an open-air exhibition to give colors back to Paris.
section: == Life and career == | === 2021–present ===

sentences: Collaborating with a number of artists and his sister Yasmine, Mika created a series of posters that were displayed on the Morris columns and other advertising boards around the city.
section: == Life and career == | === 2021–present ===

sentences: With the COVID-19 pandemic starting to get under control in the spring of 2021, Mika announced two concerts at the Philharmonie de Paris for October.
section: == Life and career == | === 2021–present ===

sentences: The concerts were to be performed with the National Orchestra of Ile de France and the Choeur Stella Maris.
section: == Life and career == | === 2021–present ===

sentences: For Pride Month (June), Mika partnered with job-search platform Indeed, for an initiative called "Soundtrack of Empathy."
section: == Life and career == | === 2021–present ===

sentences: The initiative encouraged workers to share their music playlists with colleagues, in an effort to create a more empathetic workplace.
section: == Life and career == | === 2021–present ===

sentences: Along with the "Soundtrack of Empathy," Mika performed a live-streamed benefit concert, which raised $40,000 for Lady Gaga's Born This Way Foundation.
section: == Life and career == | === 2021–present ===

sentences: There was also an influencer roundtable featuring artists selected by Mika, who spoke about the shared language of music and how it naturally encourages empathy and sparks vulnerability.
section: == Life and career == | === 2021–present ===

sentences: Mika performed at two private concerts hosted by jeweler Chopard during the Cannes Film Festival in July.
section: == Life and career == | === 2021–present ===

sentences: While attending these events, he was followed by Italian filmmaker Pif, who aired a special episode in the fall on a day in Mika's life on the Italian television show Il Testimone (The Witness).
section: == Life and career == | === 2021–present ===

sentences: Mika continued his work as a judge with X Factor Italia in 2021, and also rejoined The Voice in France, for a special "All-Stars" 10th anniversary edition.
section: == Life and career == | === 2021–present ===

sentences: September 2021 marked Mika's return to larger performances, as he headlined a private event hosted by American Express for its premium cardholders.
section: == Life and career == | === 2021–present ===

sentences: The concert was held at Salle Pleyel in Paris for about 2000 attendees.
section: == Life and career == | === 2021–present ===

sentences: The concerts at Philharmonie de Paris occurred as scheduled on 23 and 24 October.
section: == Life and career == | === 2021–present ===

sentences: The 23 October concert was filmed and subsequently broadcast on TV in both France and Italy.
section: == Life and career == | === 2021–present ===

sentences: In early December 2021, Mika announced that he would be continuing his partnership with Indeed, which would sponsor a short North American tour in Spring 2022.
section: == Life and career == | === 2021–present ===

sentences: With stops in cities like New York (Brooklyn), Boston, Montreal and Toronto, the "For the Rite of Spring Tour" is scheduled to span three weeks in April.
section: == Life and career == | === 2021–present ===

sentences: A concert set for London's famous Roundhouse venue was announced for July 3, 2022.
section: == Life and career == | === 2021–present ===

sentences: It will be Mika's first concert in London in more than two years.
section: == Life and career == | === 2021–present ===

sentences: In addition, several festival dates in France were announced in December, with more to come.
section: == Life and career == | === 2021–present ===

sentences: On 2 February 2022, it was announced that Mika will host the Eurovision Song Contest 2022 alongside Laura Pausini and Alessandro Cattelan.
section: == Life and career == | === 2021–present ===
== Personal life ==

sentences: Personal life ==
section: == Personal life ==

sentences: Mika's legal name is Michael Holbrook Penniman, Jr., but he was given the nickname Mica by his mother.
section: == Personal life ==

sentences: As he grew older, he changed the 'c' to a 'k'.
section: == Personal life ==

sentences: Mika has one younger brother and one younger sister along with two older sisters.
section: == Personal life ==

sentences: His oldest sister Yasmine, who works as an artist under the nom de plume DaWack, painted the cartoon art for his two albums Life in Cartoon Motion and The Boy Who Knew Too Much.
section: == Personal life ==

sentences: In addition to English, Mika speaks French, Spanish and Italian fluently; in an interview on 28 September 2009 with The Chris Moyles Show on BBC Radio 1 he commented that he had taken Mandarin Chinese lessons for nine years but does not speak it very well; he also mentioned that his three sisters speak it fluently.
section: == Personal life ==

sentences: He also speaks a little Arabic, in a Lebanese dialect.
section: == Personal life ==

sentences: Mika holds dual UK and US citizenship.
section: == Personal life ==

sentences: Early in his career, many questions about Mika's sexual orientation arose, but he declined to label himself.
section: == Personal life ==

sentences: In a September 2009 interview in Gay & Night Mika commented on his sexuality: "I've never ever labelled myself.
section: == Personal life ==

sentences: But having said that, I've never limited my life, I've never limited who I sleep with ... Call me whatever you want.
section: == Personal life ==

sentences: Call me bisexual, if you need a term for me ..."
section: == Personal life ==

sentences: Later he stated in an interview with This Is London: "I consider myself label-less because I could fall in love with anybody – literally – any type, any body.
section: == Personal life ==

sentences: I'm not picky.
section: == Personal life ==

sentences: "A few years later, in an August 2012 interview with the magazine Instinct, the singer described himself as gay.
section: == Personal life ==

sentences: More recently, Mika has been more open about his family life and his personal relationship with filmmaker Andreas Dermanis, with whom he's been involved for more than 10 years.
section: == Personal life ==

sentences: Mika has been involved over the years with the French charitable organization Imagine for Margo / Children without Cancer.
section: == Personal life ==

sentences: In 2014 and 2015, Mika and the late photographer Peter Lindbergh worked together on an advertising campaign for the charity.
section: == Personal life ==

sentences: Mika's image continues to be used in ads for the organization.
section: == Personal life ==

sentences: In December 2015, Mika visited Lebanon with UNHCR, the UN Refugee Agency, and spent time with refugees who had been forced to flee their homes during the ongoing conflict in Syria.
section: == Personal life ==

sentences: Since then, he has made several video messages in support of this organization and in November 2017 was a special guest at a UNHCR charity event held in Milan.
section: == Personal life ==

sentences: Mika has stated that he practices transcendental meditation and finds it useful.
section: == Personal life ==

sentences: Since 2013, he has spent a lot of time in Italy, where he has a house and a studio in Tuscany in the province of Florence.
section: == Personal life ==
